column4: So I just instlaled Ubuntu 9.10 on my newish laptop (its old, but newly mine) and the notifications that are popping up are all black with some what "scratches" - it looks horrible. How can I fix tihs?
mind getting a screenshot of it?
http://imgur.com/ will do
not stupid at all
open a terminal, sudo apt-get install notify-send, then once its done just type notify-send "whatever"
try libnotify-bin
now just type notify-send "whatever" "whatever"
http://imgur.com/laIVf.png
wow that is weird
i also have al leffects turned off
try enabling compiz (set effects on)
What graphics card do you have?
I have a funny feeling you are having driver issues, hlfshell there are replacements, but its probably best to fix this
give me a second to do some research into your laptop
open a terminal, type lspci, then paste the output to http://pastebin.ca/ (to copy in a terminal press ctrl+shift+c)
Oh lawd, you have an ATI laptop, ATI are very quirky on ubuntu
looking into it now

Ok, I don't have a clue, since according to the internet the drivers for your card (Radeon Mobility 7500) are already bundled with ubuntu, so I think someone else will have to help you, as this is out of my depth
to disable the notifications I guess you could just disable them, but that seems a bit extreme
you can uninstall them with sudo apt-get remove notify-osd
I suggest you ask your question again including the name of your card (mobility 7500)
